title: Economy Week Ahead: Retail Sales, the Fed and Jobless Claims
sub_head: Observers expect China’s growth momentum to remain strong in November, while U.S. industrial production is expected to increase
body:
U.S. retail sales and the Federal Reserve’s policy meeting highlight this week’s economic news. Economists are also monitoring Capitol Hill, where lawmakers are working on a package to support economic growth.
MONDAY
The Bank of Japan’s tankan corporate sentiment survey is likely to show the diffusion index measuring sentiment among large manufacturers improved to minus 14 in three months to December from minus 27 in the previous survey as production and exports recovered along with the reopening of the global economy.
TUESDAY
China’s growth momentum likely remained strong in November, with economists expecting gauges of domestic consumption and investment to gain steam. Retail sales, fixed-asset investment and industrial output figures will all shed more light on the pace of the country’s rebound from a short but sharp downturn early in the year.
